issue.title: Bug: Failed to load file: No materials remaining

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Global flag to mark a deviation from expected behaviour

labels.name: glTF2.0
labels.description: Bugs related to the glTF2.0 format

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When an incomplete glTF model is being loaded, specifying `aiProcess_RemoveRedundantMaterials` causes a crash during post-processing, with the message "No materials remaining".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Build the `assimp` command from source.

2. Unzip the "Running.gltf" file from the following archive:
[test.zip](https://github.com/assimp/assimp/files/14058247/test.zip)

3. Execute the following command:
    `bin/assimp info Running.gltf -rrm`

**Expected behavior**
If the model being loaded contains no materials, then RemoveRedundantMaterials post-processing should have no effect. The model should load as if the option hadn't been specified.

**Screenshots**
```console
$ bin/assimpd info Running.gltf -rrm
param = -rrm
Launching asset import ...           OK
Validating postprocessing flags ...  OK
100 %ERROR: Failed to load file: No materials remaining
assimp info: Unable to load input file Running.gltf
```

**Platform (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux Mint 21.3
 - Browser: FireFox
 - Assimp version: GIT commit ac29847d

**Additional context**
not applicable

issue.title: Kimkulling/fix bahavior of remove redundat mats issue 5438

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

body: Address sanitizer output is available from #5438

Correction: the crash does not occur during post-processing. It occurs while calculating the scene's memory usage.

https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/ff5b0ae575082fcd10b9c887390c321a110d2051/code/Common/Importer.cpp#L1268

Using GDB, I set a breakpoint at code/Common/Importer.cpp line 1268, and saw that `mScene->mNumMaterials` is 1. I believe it should've been set to zero in `RemoveRedundantMatsProcess::Execute()`.

Stepping through `RemoveRedundantMatsProcess::Execute()`, I see it return from line 161:

https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/ff5b0ae575082fcd10b9c887390c321a110d2051/code/PostProcessing/RemoveRedundantMaterials.cpp#L159-L162

At that point, `mMaterials[0]` has been set to `nullptr`, but `mNumMaterials` has not been updated---it is still 1. That explains the segmentation violation.
I could easily write a PR to solve this issue, but after what happened with #5438 I've decided to wait for an explicit PR request and not submit unsolicited code.

Hi, would be great if you could prepare a PR for this issue.

Thanks!

issue.title: fix issue #5461 (segfault after removing redundant materials)

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

body: Since #5467 is integrated, I believe this issue is solved and can be closed.

issue.title: glTFs with an AnimComposer but no skeleton throw an exception

repository.name: MonkeyWrench
repository.description: A versatile library for loading 3-D assets into JMonkeyEngine  (code has New BSD license)

issue.body:
Reported by @capdevon at the JME forum: 

https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/assimp-based-model-import-and-the-monkeywrench-library/46930/66

A copy of the stack trace:
```console
SEVERE: Uncaught exception thrown in Thread[jME3 Main,5,main]
com.jme3.asset.AssetLoadException: An exception has occurred while loading asset: Models/Zombiegirl/Running.gltf
	at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadLocatedAsset(DesktopAssetManager.java:274)
	at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadAsset(DesktopAssetManager.java:388)
	at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadModel(DesktopAssetManager.java:439)
	at com.capdevon.test.Test_AssetManager.simpleInitApp(Test_AssetManager.java:69)
	at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.initialize(SimpleApplication.java:240)
	at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglWindow.initInThread(LwjglWindow.java:607)
	at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglWindow.run(LwjglWindow.java:710)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Assimp failed to import an asset from "Models/Zombiegirl/Running.gltf":
 No materials remaining
	at com.github.stephengold.wrench.LwjglAssetLoader.loadScene(LwjglAssetLoader.java:144)
	at com.github.stephengold.wrench.LwjglAssetLoader.load(LwjglAssetLoader.java:95)
	at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadLocatedAsset(DesktopAssetManager.java:272)
	... 7 more
```
